ai.summary: A short, easy coastal walk to Island Reagh in Strangford Lough, covering about 0.7 km in total. Ideal for a quick stroll with sea views and a chance to observe local wildlife.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat coastal paths with grassy sections and some compact rocky or gravel surfaces. Expect wet or slippery patches near the shoreline and uneven ground near tidal areas; stay on marked trails.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times before visiting Strangford Lough to avoid getting cut off by rising water. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip and bring a light waterproof layer. Stay away from unstable edge breaks, respect fences and private property, and keep an eye on weather and sea state. Take a mobile phone for emergencies and avoid visiting in strong winds or heavy seas.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn offers the best weather and longer daylight; visit in mild, dry conditions for the most enjoyable experience.
